post_text:
Attention RHS Football Players and Parents,

We have been notified by the Lathrop School District that Richmond football players who played in the game on Friday night may have been exposed to COVID-19. At this time a triad decision between the school district, Ray County Health Department and the hospital have decided that all Richmond football players who played in the game need to stay at home, self-quarantine, and monitor for symptoms until further notice. As we get more information, local health departments will be investigating and contact tracing. Any player who experiences symptoms should contact their primary care physician.
text:
Attention RHS Football Players and Parents,

We have been notified by the Lathrop School District that Richmond football players who played in the game on Friday night may have been exposed to COVID-19. At this time a triad decision between the school district, Ray County Health Department and the hospital have decided that all Richmond football players who played in the game need to stay at home, self-quarantine, and monitor for symptoms until further notice. As we get more information, local health departments will be investigating and contact tracing. Any player who experiences symptoms should contact their primary care physician.

post_text: It's important to evaluate your child's health every morning. Before he or she leaves the house, check for a fever and monitor other conditions to determine if your student is well enough for school.

post_text:
Richmond Spartan fans and supporters, tomorrow's football game vs. Lathrop will be livestreamed at https://youtu.be/hFM9_qdBWFY . Fans are welcome at the game, but we do require that you wear a mask anytime you are inside the gate. We also ask that all spectators keep at least 6' of space at all times from other spectators. Concessions will be available, but options will be limited to items that do not require food handling.

Please do your part to ensure that we can continue having spectators at all home events. Thank you.
text:
Richmond Spartan fans and supporters, tomorrow's football game vs. Lathrop will be livestreamed at https://youtu.be/hFM9_qdBWFY . Fans are welcome at the game, but we do require that you wear a mask anytime you are inside the gate. We also ask that all spectators keep at least 6' of space at all times from other spectators. Concessions will be available, but options will be limited to items that do not require food handling.

Please do your part to ensure that we can continue having spectators at all home events. Thank you.

post_text:
Great first day back Spartan Nation! We were excited to see everyone. Students and staff did a great job following safety protocols today. Flexibility will be key as we move forward. We will be continuing to make adjustments to make sure that we are doing everything we can to maintain safety for everyone.

When inside, here are examples of proper face coverings. We will also continue to practice good social distancing when possible.

GO SPARTANS!

post_text:
RMS & RHS Choice B (Launch) Students,
Our counselors are working hard to get you enrolled in Launch courses. Please see the attached message we received from Launch. Because of the high demand, it may be closer to the end of the week before Launch will contact you. That means your school start date may be a few days delayed. Once Launch contacts you, you will then be able to begin your courses. If you have further questions, please contact your counselor by email.

post_text:
RMS/RHS Student Athletes & Parents,
Fall sports practices will begin soon.

RHS - August 10, 2020
RMS - August 17, 2020

All students must register at the High School Office to participate. Most students will need a new 2-year MSHSAA physical this year before they can receive a practice card.

Registration packets & physical forms can be picked up at the District Office or at the High School front doors beginning on Friday, July 17 from 8:00-3:00.

See the pictures attached to view the sport registration process. Visit the Athletic Page on the District's website at www.richmondspartans.org for more information.

shared_text:
Richmond High School, Richmond, Missouri
June 15 at 12:40 PM ·

RICHMOND- Nick Persell has been selected as the next Head Baseball Coach at Richmond High School. Persell takes over for Brandon Quick who accepted the RHS Assistant Principal position. Persell played for the Spartans under Brandon Quick.

Persell was an assistant baseball coach at Staley High School before returning to Richmond. During his time at Staley, they made runs to the final four twice, finishing 4th in 2013 and 2nd in 2015. Coach Persell has been an assistant baseball coach at Richmond since 2016.
text:
Richmond High School, Richmond, Missouri
June 15 at 12:40 PM ·

RICHMOND- Nick Persell has been selected as the next Head Baseball Coach at Richmond High School. Persell takes over for Brandon Quick who accepted the RHS Assistant Principal position. Persell played for the Spartans under Brandon Quick.

Persell was an assistant baseball coach at Staley High School before returning to Richmond. During his time at Staley, they made runs to the final four twice, finishing 4th in 2013 and 2nd in 2015. Coach Persell has been an assistant baseball coach at Richmond since 2016.

Today we celebrated some milestones for staff members of the Richmond R-XVI School District.

March 26 at 7:11 PM ·

RHS Students,

We miss you a lot! During your time off please make sure that you are checking your grades in PowerSchool! If you are missing assignments you should be emailing your teachers ASAP to ask what your options are! Don't wait!

We also have resources online to continue your learning! Go to www.richmondspartans.org to get review / enrichment materials.

STAY SAFE SPARTANS! Please practice social distancing!

#WeAreRichmond

post_text: The Richmond Spartans defeat Ewing Marion Kauffman in the championship game of the Richmond Winter Classic! 67-58. Dionte Marquez led the Spartans with 25 points and Wyatt Covey chipped in 10.
text: The Richmond Spartans defeat Ewing Marion Kauffman in the championship game of the Richmond Winter Classic! 67-58. Dionte Marquez led the Spartans with 25 points and Wyatt Covey chipped in 10.

post_text: Led by Dionte Marquez's 27 points, the Richmond Spartans defeated Southwest in the semifinal game of the Richmond Winter Classic. The Spartans will play for gold on Saturday against Kauffman at 5:30 pm.

Congrats to the Richmond Spartan Wrestling Team for placing 7th out of 42 teams in the Battle of the Katy Trail in Sedalia this weekend.

Teat 3rd
Claypole 3rd
Hutchings 4th
Ivison 4th
Plymell 7th
Renfro 9th
Rice 12th
Penniston 17th
Williams 22nd
Burch 24th
Logsdon 28th
